0.title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2012
0.description: Altering or repealing specified required appropriations; altering the distribution of specified revenues; altering or repealing specified funding requirements; altering the authorized use of specified funds; authorizing the transfer of specified funds; etc.

1.title: State and Local Revenue and Financing Act of 2012
1.description: Increasing the State individual income tax rates on specified amounts of income; altering the amount that specified individuals may deduct as an exemption under the income tax; requiring specified business trusts to add specified income to federal adjusted gross income to determine Maryland adjusted gross income; altering the tax rate for specified tobacco products; providing, for purposes of the recordation tax, that specified security interest in real property is deemed to be treated as debt incurred; altering specified fees; etc.

2.title: Creation of a State Debt - Qualified Zone Academy Bonds
2.description: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $15,324,000, the proceeds to be used as grants to the Interagency Committee on School Construction and the Maryland State Department of Education for specified development or improvement purposes; providing for disbursement of the loan proceeds and the further grant of funds to eligible school systems for specified purposes, subject to a requirement that the grantees document the provision of a required matching fund; etc.

3.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
3.title: Courts - Dangerous Dog Presumption - Specific Breed Prohibition
3.description: Establishing that, for the purpose of determining criminal or civil liability, a dog may not be presumed dangerous or potentially dangerous solely on the basis of the breed or heritage of the dog; providing that the Act does not preclude a political subdivision from adopting or enforcing a program to control dangerous or potentially dangerous dogs if the program does not discriminate among dogs solely on the basis of the breed or heritage of the dog; applying the Act prospectively; and making the Act an emergency measure.

4.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
4.title: Vehicle Laws - Special Registration Plate - United States Armed Forces
4.description: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to develop and make available for specified vehicles a special registration plate honoring the armed forces of the United States; requiring that fees charged for the plates be used only for specified purposes; requiring a registration plate issued under the Act to contain a specified graphic design and specified words; and requiring the Administration to adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of the Act.

5.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
5.title: Courts - Dog Bite Lawsuits - Evidence and Standard of Proof
5.description: Establishing that in a cause of action involving damages resulting from a dog bite, the common law rules of evidence and standard of proof that existed on January 1, 2012, are retained without regard to the breed or heritage of the dog; stating the General Assembly's intent to overturn the ruling in a specified court case; and applying the Act prospectively.

6.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
6.title: The Maryland Dog Nondiscrimination Act
6.description: Establishing that in a cause of action involving damages resulting from a dog bite, the common law rules of evidence and standard of proof that existed on January 1, 2012, are retained without regard to the breed or heritage of the dog; stating the General Assembly's intent to overturn the ruling in a specified court case; and applying the Act prospectively.

7.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
7.title: Courts - Civil Liability for Injuries Inflicted by Dogs
7.description: Establishing that no person may be held civilly liable for an injury inflicted by a dog of any breed or heritage unless the person had responsibility for exercising control over the dog and was negligent in exercising that control; and making the Act an emergency measure.

8.last_action: First Reading House Rules and Executive Nominations
8.title: Medical Marijuana - Caregiver - Affirmative Defense
8.description: Establishing that it is an affirmative defense to a prosecution for the possession of marijuana or the possession of specified drug paraphernalia that the marijuana or drug paraphernalia was intended for medical use by an individual with a specified debilitating medical condition for whom the defendant is a specified caregiver; etc.

12.title: Procurement - Required Clauses - Project Labor Agreement Prohibition
12.description: Requiring State procurement contracts to include a clause prohibiting specified parties from participating in specified project labor agreements.

13.title: Environment - On-Site Sewage Disposal Systems - Nitrogen Removal Technology
13.description: Prohibiting the Department of the Environment from adopting regulations that require a person to install, or have installed, an on-site sewage disposal system that utilizes nitrogen removal technology on specified property in the State.

14.title: Office of the Inspector General - Establishment
14.description: Establishing the office of Inspector General; specifying eligibility qualifications that an individual must meet for the office; providing that the Inspector General is subject to removal by the General Assembly under specified circumstances; specifying the duties and powers of the Inspector General; submitting the amendment to the qualified voters of the State of Maryland for their adoption or rejection; etc.

16.last_action: Unfavorable Report by Budget and Taxation
16.title: Budget - Reductions to Appropriations - Level Funding for Fiscal Year 2013
16.description: Reducing specified State education funding for fiscal year 2013; and reducing specified public safety, personnel, transportation, environment, health, and education appropriations for fiscal year 2013.

17.title: State Government - Inspector General
17.description: Specifying that there is an Inspector General of the State; establishing the Office of the Inspector General; requiring the Inspector General to examine and investigate the management and affairs of units and conduct audits of the units; authorizing the Inspector General to investigate specified matters; requiring that a unit cooperate fully with the Inspector General under specified circumstances; requiring that the Inspector General have access to specified documents of a unit under specified circumstances; etc.

18.title: Dorchester County - Restriction on Sunday Gaming - Repeal
18.description: Repealing a restriction that prohibits specified gaming licensees in Dorchester County from holding gaming events or carnivals on a Sunday.
